snippet: Marvin Wexler, a commercial litigator, also cultivates another side of himself, reading poetry to a room full of elderly and disabled residents at a nursing home.
abstract: Marvin Wexler, hard-boiled commercial litigator skilled at defending commercial clients, pays monthly visits to Sarah Neuman Center, nursing home in Westchester County, to read poetry to senior citizens; Wexler, motivated by past experiences with his own parents, feels that readings are good way to connect with elderly.
lead_paragraph: Marvin Wexler, a commercial litigator, also cultivates another side of himself, reading poetry to a room full of elderly and disabled residents at a nursing home.

headline.main: Soothing the Aged With Verse, a Lawyer Takes a Road Less Traveled
